str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock of men. Of uncertain affinity; a shepherd.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To praise. From ainos; to praise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
